Articles.Content: would it be possible to make this a secondary system?

okay i dont go on this site very often so im not very good at using the message board but i just have to ask im trying to use RealExoplanets but it forces the barycenter to become the sun again i tried changing the name of the exoplanets stars reference body to the barycenters name but that didnt work so i thought wait ill just see what you had the reference body set to for kerbol i was suprised that it was set as the sun and not the new name for the sun a.k.a the barycenter so im just curious on how you accomplished this and if there is any way you could help me understand how i could manage to pull that off for the RealExoplanets my personal guess is because kerbol is a part of your mod youve managed to work out this issue before releasing it but other mods that use the sun as a reference body arent supported in such a way that it just forces the barycenter to become the sun again if theres nothing that can be done about it i will just accept defeat and deal with the trinary star system but your mod is so beautiful with the binary systems lighting id like to see if i can restore it to its former glory even if i have to mess with R.E configs for hours just let me know what you did to make kerbol work without it forcing the sun i do get a nonstop spammed console error code saying Nullreferenceexeption Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Hi,

I run AVP, however, I want to install this mod.

Will any visual mods affect the planets? Or will this not be affected by the visual mods for the simple fact it is not compatible?

 

Thanks!

9 hours ago, Enchiladus said:

Hi,

I run AVP, however, I want to install this mod.

Will any visual mods affect the planets? Or will this not be affected by the visual mods for the simple fact it is not compatible?

 

Thanks!

Compatibility of a visual pack to a planet pack is entirely opt-in. Each body needs to be configed in the visual pack, and if not done, expect the visual pack to have no effect. There is the exception that Kerbin and Sun must always exist, even if their display names are different (in this planet mod's case: Rhode and the Tempus Barycenter). AVP may still apply to them and if so, will cause an ugly scene by overlapping with this mod's own visual pack.
I havent gotten to the point of leaving Rhode's SoI yet but I really like this planet pack so far.

Oh, and when I installed it I had an old save I decided to load just to see what happened, I got to see Fate and Destiny up close.

These are all just from CRP. If planets don't have specific values set, then it's all RNG. You may have just had an unfortunate roll.
Probably a bad roll from the RNG. I remember a few months ago, someone I talk to regularly had reported they couldn't get ExoticMinerals or RareMetals near the KSC. Same mechanism.

Edited July 27, 2020 by Totally

1 hour ago, Totally said:

Hey, im struggling to play BeyondHome, i have everything installed correctly, as it tells me this on the loading screen, but when i load into the game, it is just normal KSP, any help?

I bet you're on KSP 1.10. Kopernicus is version locked, or should be, and is not to be expected to function properly (or at all) on 1.10.

If you see Nyan Cats having a party, your game is already over.
